titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John W. Phillips, Judgment
CWG4950

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Harrison Circuit Court
May Term.
May 2 1864.
Commonwealth of Kentucky
Agst
John W. Phillips-

It appearing that the sureties of the Deft., in his recognizance herein, towit Jno A Kirkpatric & Wesley Barrett have been duly served with summons, and failing to answer. It is adjudged that the Pltff recover of said Jno. A. Kirkpatric and Wesley Barrett the sum of $1000- being the amount undertaken by them in their the recognizance aforesaid and her costs herein Expended- It is further ordered that execution issue there for."
A copy att J. F. Ware C. H. C. C

Commonlth
vs } Cop: Judgt
Jno.. W. Phillips
